required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Controlling Post-extraction Complications of Impacted Mandibular Third Molar
clinical_study.official_title: Methylprednisolone and Hyaluronic Acid Versus Each Agent Alone to Control Post-extraction Complications of Impacted Mandibular Third Molar

brief_summary.textblock: Impacted mandibular 3rd molar will be extracted in all patients, then patients will be divided, according to material placed in extraction socket into 3 groups: control, hyaluronic acid and honey. Then post extraction complications will be evaluated

detailed_description.textblock: Impacted Mandibular third molar will be extracted under local anesthesia Through standard surgical flap elevation, after extraction and wound irrigation a material facilitate healing will be placed. According to material will be placed patients will be divide into 3 group: control ( no material, second group hyaluronic acid, third group ( honey).. then wound will be closed. Postoperative pain ( through visual analog scale) , edema, total dose of analgesic, mandibular movement (interincisal distance in mm) will be evaluated preoperative, 1,2,3,7, and 10 day after extraction

primary_outcome.measure: Size of edema will be assessed from finial angle and Travis of ear to mental ala of Nes and mouth angle
primary_outcome.description: Edema measured from gonial angle and Tragus to mental, angle of mouth, ala of nose, and lateral canthus of eye respectively

arm_group.description: Normal saline irrigation after extraction and No drug placed in tooth socket
Methylprednisolone will be given intravenous to a patient half an hour before the surgery
Methylprednisolone will be given intravenous to a patient half an hour before the surgery and Gengigel (Hyaluronic acid) placed after extraction

intervention.description: Normal saline irrigation and No other drug placed after extraction
Immediately after removal of impacted tooth (hyaluronic acid) placed in extraction socket
Methylprednsolone will be injected half an hour preoperatively
Methylprednisolone will be injected half an hour preoperatively and Immediately after removal of impacted tooth (hyaluronic acid) placed in extraction socket

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy patients
- patient has impacted 3rd molar
Exclusion Criteria:
- medically compromised patients Heavy smoking patients
